Posts.Content: TealWarrior wrote: I'm a late stage Ovarian cancer survivor, BRCA 1, just had a double mastectomy with implants on 1/12 after LCIS DX.The drains were removed on Thursday 1/22. I'm really uncomfortable. There are what feels like balls of fluid moving around on my side. I'm really swollen and can't get comfortable. Is all this still normal for this many days post surgery? Stage 3C Ovarian Cancer Survivor DX April 2011 Chemotherapy 5/1/2011 Carboplatin (Paraplatin), Taxol (paclitaxel) Dx 10/2014, LCIS, Stage 0, 0/1 nodes Surgery 1/12/2015 Mastectomy: Left, Right; Reconstruction (left); Reconstruction (right) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: In Pain - Need Advice TealWarrior TealWarrior

Posts.Content: Jan 26, 2015 04:43PM TealWarrior wrote: Thank you ladies! I'm pretty sure it's a Seroma too. The PS didn't seem tocare much this morning but when I called back today after I noticed some small bleeding at the incision they got more interested. If I'm still spotting tomorrow they said they'd bring me in. The ball of fluid rolling around really grosses me out. I think it also triggers some of the shooting nerve pains.
